name: scenario
moduleDoc:
Scenario module - Core scenario definition types and utilities

This module exports the fundamental types for scenario definitions,
along with loader and selector utilities.

jsDoc.doc: Source location in a file (for better error messages)
Maximum number of attempts (1 = no retry)
Default options applied to all steps in scenario

Cleanup returned by setup functions

Supports multiple cleanup patterns:
- `void`: No cleanup needed
- Function: Cleanup function to be called
- `Disposable`: Object with `[Symbol.dispose]()` method
- `AsyncDisposable`: Object with `[Symbol.asyncDispose]()` method
Context provided to steps, resources, and setup hooks

tags.name: Previous
tags.doc: - Type of the previous step result

tags.name: Results
tags.doc: - Tuple type of accumulated results from all previous steps

jsDoc.doc: All accumulated results as typed tuple

tags.name: T
tags.doc: - Type of this step's return value

tags.name: Previous
tags.doc: - Type of the previous step result

jsDoc.doc:
Function signature for setup hooks

Setup hooks can access accumulated results and resources.
They return a cleanup function/disposable that will be called after the scenario.

tags.name: Previous
tags.doc: - Type of the previous step result

jsDoc.doc:
Function signature for resource factories

Resource factories create resources that will be available to subsequent
steps, setups, and other resource factories.

tags.name: Previous
tags.doc: - Type of the previous step result

tags.name: Resources
tags.doc: - Already registered resources available to this factory

tags.name: T
tags.doc: - Type of this step's return value

tags.name: Previous
tags.doc: - Type of the previous step result

tags.name: Previous
tags.doc: - Type of the previous step result

tags.name: Previous
tags.doc: - Type of the previous step result

tags.name: Resources
tags.doc: - Already registered resources available to this factory

jsDoc.doc: Resource name (used as key in resources object)

Entry in a scenario - discriminated union of step, resource, or setup

The `kind` field serves as the discriminant for type narrowing.
Uses default type parameters (all `unknown`) for storage.

Definition of a scenario (immutable)

This is the core type that represents a complete scenario definition.
It contains all the information needed to execute the scenario.
Entries to execute (steps, resources, setups) in order
Metadata for a step (serializable, without function)
Metadata for a setup (serializable, without function)
Metadata for a resource (serializable, without function)
Metadata entry - discriminated union for serializable entries
Metadata for a scenario (serializable, without functions)

Callback invoked when an import error occurs

If not provided, errors are silently ignored.
Load scenarios from specified file paths

tags.name: scenarioFiles
tags.doc: - Array of absolute file paths or URLs to load

jsDoc.doc: Negation flag - if true, matches scenarios that do NOT match the selector
Parse a selector string into an array of Selector objects

tags.doc:
parseSelector("tag:api") // [{ type: "tag", value: /api/, negated: false }]
parseSelector("!tag:slow") // [{ type: "tag", value: /slow/, negated: true }]
parseSelector("tag:api,!tag:slow") // [{ type: "tag", value: /api/, negated: false }, { type: "tag", value: /slow/, negated: true }]

jsDoc.doc: Check if a scenario matches a single selector

tags.doc: True if the scenario matches the selector

jsDoc.doc:
Apply selectors to scenarios with AND/OR/NOT logic

Logic:
- Multiple selector strings: OR condition
- Comma-separated selectors within a string: AND condition
- ! prefix: NOT condition (negation)

tags.name: selectorInputs
tags.doc: - Array of selector strings (OR between strings, AND within strings)
